result.execSummary:
The defendant Ann Marie Scheel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CASES: 15CF108 & 15CF348. Defendant Ann Marie Scheel in court with attorney Nicholas Von Davis.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 9:37 am.  

15CF108-Count 1 AMENDED to 943.20(1a) misd theft.  Def-NC plea.  CT-accept plea, adj guilty & judgment entered.  Amendment made on the record, NO amended information to be filed.
15CF348-Count 1 REDUCED to 946.49(1)(a) misd bail jump.  Def-guilty.  CT-accept plea, adj guilty & judgment entered.  Amendment made on the record, NO amended information to be filed.  All other counts DRI.  
Exh 1-3 O&R.
SENTENCE: On ea - w/h sentence, probation up to 1 yr.  Order DNA sample on each.  No DNA surcharge.  
15CF108-$265.60 fine/costs.  FTP at end of probation is judgment.
15CF348-Restitution $360 Kelch, Fisher-$750, Todd-$1250 - 10% surcharge.  J&S with Mr Udstuen-15CF444.  No Contact: David Dumke, 1693 140th Ave in SCF, Shannon Kelch, Kenneth Fisher, Todd Walters.  PCR.  Must report to probation today.  10:08 am adj.
